Key Match Events: Granit Xhaka was sent off in a fiery clash between Denmark and Switzerland on September 5, 2024.
Switzerland’s Silvan Widmer was booked for wasting time.
Nico Elvedi was sent off for a last-man foul on Kasper Dolberg.
Patrick Dorgu scored the opening goal for Denmark.
Granit Xhaka received a yellow card for his complaints.
Pierre-Emile Hojbjerg, Morten Hjulmand, and Manuel Akanji also received yellow cards.
Granit Xhaka was shown a second yellow card and subsequently a red card for a late challenge on Pierre-Emile Hojbjerg.
Pierre-Emile Hojbjerg scored a second goal for Denmark.
Post-Match Reflections: Joachim Andersen commented on Granit Xhaka's behavior, stating, 'He is a top footballer, but he is also a bit of a b***h.'

Joachim Andersen added, 'We know Granit, and he can go to it once in a while and get a little angry on the pitch. That’s the way it is. He is a player I have a lot of respect for, and sometimes you can lose your head.'
Joachim Andersen reflected, 'I think he has been good at keeping calm for many years, but today he lost his head a little.'
Granit Xhaka will be suspended for Switzerland’s match against Spain on Sunday.
